page.title: 01A SUMMARY OF THE AREA
page.content: The area varies from being very urban in the N.W. to rural in the S. and E. This results in a very interesting variety of subjects to study. The area includes a great variety of housing from the very old farms to new modern estates. We have an industrial estate and a large factory- Sterling Metals. We have both farms for animal rearing and crops. The Coventry Canal runs through the area, as does the Wem Brook, which is a tributary of the River Anker. The area is steeped in history. There is, for example The White Stone,which marks the stopping place on the old coaching route from Nuneaton to Lutterworth. To many people, the most famous person who is associated with the area is George Eliot. One of the local schools is named after the famous novelist.
